intro: Sloanea quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces a unique fruit that splits into four valves when mature. Sloanea quadrivalvis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests.
